So currently i have a space station in a 20km circular orbit. I really want to put it into an orbit were i can see the northern lights (a mod). (i will change it, if i do, with a soyuz currently docked)

The thing is i know how i would get up there but i have no idea how i would land my space shuttle? (on the runway)

Edited March 17, 2014 by montyben101
You would just wait until your space station's orbit lines up over KSC before de-orbiting your shuttle.
How long would i have to wait? The only thing is that i have the tac life support plugin installed

it depends on the height

if it's geostationary and above the KSC before the inclination change, after the inclination change it would meet up with KSC twice per revolution

Its at 20km How long would that be? Ideally im looking at a 60 to 70 degree orbit

Edited March 17, 2014 by montyben101
You really can't already see the auroras if you're 200km up? That's pretty far...
Wait im being an idiot.... 20km..... *face desk* sorry

An awful lot of "when to deorbit" a spaceplane/shuttle depends on how it flies once it's back in atmosphere and how much (if any) fuel it has. In the simplest case - deorbit whenever you feel like it and fly through the atmosphere to line-up on approach. In the worst case - it all depends not only on how high your orbit, or its inclination, but where on that orbit you currently are and where its equitorial nodes (AN/DN) are 'around' the planet from KSC.
